resourcetypes.name: Accounts
resourcetypes.description: An account on a site, or with a service. Could be a human user or a bot.

attributes.name: displayname
attributes.description: As distinct from the login name/UID.

attributes.name: notes
attributes.description: Notes about this account.

resourcetypes.name: Aliases
resourcetypes.notes: Another name by which someone or something is known.

resourcetypes.name: Applications
resourcetypes.notes: Software applications

attributes.name: Notes
attributes.description: Notes about the application

attributes.name: LicenseType
attributes.description: What _general kind_ of license this application is available under: commercial or free/open-source.

resourcetypes.name: ApplicationCategories
resourcetypes.notes: Wiki, accounting, social media, etc. Independent of topic.

attributes.name: Notes
attributes.description: Clarifying notes about the category.

resourcetypes.name: Books
resourcetypes.notes: Stuff printed on the corpses of trees.

attributes.name: ISBN
attributes.description: International Standard Book Number. Should be a 10- or 13-digit number. Deprecated; use either ISBN10 or ISBN13

attributes.name: ISBN10
attributes.description: International Standard Book Number, 10-digit edition.

attributes.name: ISBN13
attributes.description: International Standard Book Number, 13-digit edition

attributes.name: year
attributes.description: The year in which it was first published.

resourcetypes.name: Brands
resourcetypes.notes: Also known as ´make´.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Comments about this particular brand.

resourcetypes.name: Buildings
resourcetypes.notes: Individual buildings.

resourcetypes.name: Cities
resourcetypes.notes: The geographic kind.

resourcetypes.name: Comments
resourcetypes.notes: A comment on any object

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The text of the comment

resourcetypes.name: Countries
resourcetypes.notes: The geographic kind.

resourcetypes.name: Definitions
resourcetypes.notes: Definition of a word, phrase, abbreviation or acronym.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The actual definition goes here.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Comments about this particular email address.

resourcetypes.name: Events
resourcetypes.notes: Things that happened.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: A little more information about the event.

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: Starting date/time.

attributes.name: end
attributes.description: Ending date/time.

resourcetypes.name: Floors
resourcetypes.notes: Floors within a building.

resourcetypes.name: Howtos
resourcetypes.notes: Instructions for how to do something.

attributes.name: instructions
attributes.description: How to do it.

resourcetypes.name: Investigations
resourcetypes.notes: An investigation into something that happened.

attributes.name: Summary
attributes.description: One-line summary of what this investigation is about.

attributes.name: Description
attributes.description: Detailed description of the investigation.

resourcetypes.name: Movements
resourcetypes.notes: Emergent phenomena that aren't connected/formal enough to be called an organisation.

resourcetypes.name: OrganisationCategories
resourcetypes.notes: Denote what _kind_ of organisation it is: recording studio, zoo, sports club, etc.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Clarify exactly what I mean by this kind of org, to the extent there might be ambiguity.

resourcetypes.name: Places
resourcetypes.notes: The generic idea of a specific place, independent of its geographical location. E.g, an office or somebody's home.

resourcetypes.name: PostboxAddresses
resourcetypes.notes: The UID is the PO Box number.

resourcetypes.name: Postcodes
resourcetypes.notes: What else does this need?

resourcetypes.name: Roles
resourcetypes.notes: Organisation roles. These are dependent because they exist only in the context of an organisation.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: The purpose of the role, and what it entails.

resourcetypes.name: States
resourcetypes.notes: The geographic kind.

resourcetypes.name: StreetNumbers
resourcetypes.notes: The UID is the street number

resourcetypes.name: Teams
resourcetypes.notes: Unit of organisation within an Organisation. You _could_ just use Organisations for this, but that way lie name-collisions.

attributes.name: FullName
attributes.description: Long version of the team name, if there is one.

attributes.name: Notes
attributes.description: Notes about the team. Describing its purpose is especially useful.

resourcetypes.name: Topics
resourcetypes.notes: A specific subject, that things can be said to relate to.

attributes.name: Notes
attributes.description: Elaborating notes about what this topic is and is not about.

resourcetypes.name: Wikipages
resourcetypes.notes: generic wikipage

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: In case you want to use something other than an escaped version of the UID

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The actual text of the page.

relationships.name: HAS_COMMENT
relationships.notes: Comments can be added to anything.

relationships.name: INCLUDES
relationships.notes: This category includes that application.

relationships.name: BUILDS_ON
relationships.notes: This app is built on top of that one's functionality. One app may be built on top of several others, and by their powers combined become some kind of giant super-app.

relationships.name: DOCUMENTED_BY
relationships.notes: Some aspect of this application is documented by that wikipage.

relationships.name: IN_CATEGORY
relationships.notes: This application fits into that category.

relationships.name: PRODUCED_BY
relationships.notes: That organisation is the current vendor and/or maintainer of this app.

relationships.name: PRODUCED_BY
relationships.notes: That person is the current maintainer of this app.

relationships.name: PRODUCED_BY
relationships.notes: This application is produced by that team in particular.

relationships.name: SUPPORTS
relationships.notes: This application is what that other one is built on top of.

relationships.name: ALIAS_FOR
relationships.notes: This alias has been associated with this person. Note that multiple people may use the same alias, whether coincidentally or intentionally.

relationships.name: AUTHOR
relationships.notes: Link from the book to its author.

relationships.name: PUBLISHED_BY
relationships.notes: This book was published by that organisation.

relationships.name: RECOMMENDED_BY
relationships.notes: This person thought that book would be worth reading or consulting.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That event was reported to occur in this city.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That organisation is known to operate in this city, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That person is known to operate in this city, regardless of whether they live there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That event was reported to occur in this country.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That organisation is known to operate in this country, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That person is known to operate in this country, regardless of whether they live there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBJECT
relationships.notes: This event happened to or for that person.

relationships.name: INVOLVED
relationships.notes: That person participated in this event.

relationships.name: ORGANISED_BY
relationships.notes: That organisation was involved in organising this event.

relationships.name: ORGANISED_BY
relationships.notes: That person was involved in organising this event.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: That investigation is about this specific event.

relationships.name: HAS_AUTHOR
relationships.notes: That person wrote the content in this file.

relationships.name: DRAWN_BY
relationships.notes: That person drew this picture.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBJECT
relationships.notes: That person is a subject of this (presumably image) file.

relationships.name: PHOTOGRAPHED_BY
relationships.notes: That person took this photograph.

relationships.name: REFERENCE_FOR
relationships.notes: That investigation made some reference to this file.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBJECT
relationships.notes: This investigation is specifically about that one event.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBJECT
relationships.notes: A person using that alias is a focus of this investigation.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBJECT
relationships.notes: That person is a focus of this investigation.

relationships.name: PURSUED_BY
relationships.notes: This investigation was (or is being) pursued by that person.

relationships.name: REFERS_TO
relationships.notes: This investigation makes some kind of reference to that file.

relationships.name: HOSTED
relationships.notes: That event was hosted in this place.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: INCLUDES
relationships.notes: Cardinality is many:many because it's plausible that one org fits multiple categories.

relationships.name: INCLUDES
relationships.notes: That team is a member of this organisation.

relationships.name: HAS_MEMBERS
relationships.notes: E.g, that commercial landlord is a member of this VvE.

relationships.name: MEMBER_OF
relationships.notes: E.g, this commercial landlord is a member of that VvE.

relationships.name: ORGANISED
relationships.notes: This organisation made that event happen.

relationships.name: PUBLISHED
relationships.notes: This organisation published that book.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This organisation is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this country, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This organisation is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this state, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This organisation is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this city, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: TYPE
relationships.notes: This org is of that type/those types.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: PRODUCES
relationships.notes: This organisation sells and/or maintains that application.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: ASSOCIATED_WITH
relationships.notes: Uncomfortably vague, so should be used only where the relationship is not clear.

relationships.name: BUSINESS_PARTNER
relationships.notes: These people are (or were) business partners.

relationships.name: MEMBER_OF
relationships.notes: This person is a member of that team, and possibly of others.

relationships.name: PRODUCES
relationships.notes: This person maintains that application.

relationships.name: AUTHOR_OF
relationships.notes: Link to a book this person wrote.

relationships.name: CONTACT_METHODS
relationships.notes: An email address at which you can reach this person.

relationships.name: CONTACT_METHODS
relationships.notes: A phone number at which you can reach this person.

relationships.name: AUTHOR_OF
relationships.notes: This person wrote the content in this file.

relationships.name: DREW
relationships.notes: This person drew that picture.

relationships.name: INVOLVED_IN
relationships.notes: This person participated in that event.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This person is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this country, regardless of whether they actually live there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This person is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this state, regardless of whether they actually live there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: OPERATES_IN
relationships.notes: This person is known to do business or otherwise actively do stuff in this city, regardless of whether they actually live there. Inverse relationship for VENUE_FOR.

relationships.name: ORGANISED
relationships.notes: This person made that event happen.

relationships.name: PHOTOGRAPHED
relationships.notes: This person took that photograph.

relationships.name: PURSUED
relationships.notes: This person pursued, or is currently pursuing, that investigation.

relationships.name: RECOMMENDED
relationships.notes: This person recommended that book.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: That event happened to or for this person.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: A person using this alias is a focus of that investigation.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: This person is a focus of that investigation.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: This person is a subject of that (presumably image) file.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That event was reported to occur in this state.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That organisation is known to operate in this state, regardless of any presence there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: VENUE_FOR
relationships.notes: That person is known to operate in this state, regardless of whether they live there. Inverse relationship for OPERATES_IN.

relationships.name: MEMBER_OF
relationships.notes: This team is a member of that organisation.

relationships.name: HAS_MEMBER
relationships.notes: That person is a member of this team, and possibly also of others.

relationships.name: HAS_SUBTEAM
relationships.notes: That team is a subteam of this one, and possibly of others.

relationships.name: PRODUCES
relationships.notes: This team in in particular is responsible for maintaining that application.

relationships.name: SUBTEAM_OF
relationships.notes: This team is a subteam of that one, and possibly of others.

relationships.name: RELATES_TO
relationships.notes: This thing pertains to that topic.

relationships.name: SUBJECT_OF
relationships.notes: This is the topic of that thing over there.

relationships.name: DOCUMENTS
relationships.notes: This wikipage documents some aspect of that application.

relationships.name: REFERS_TO
relationships.notes: This wikipage refers to that book in some way.
